div.p: May the Lord Jesus keep you, most esteemed lord and dearest brother, and grant you a most prosperous year, so that you may serve the Lord Jesus and His church in health and strength! You have not suspected in vain that some in Poland are nurturing a monster; for I am sending here to your piety the letters you see, and I beg you to return them as soon as possible along with your judgment.
I believe similar letters have been written to Bern and Basel, from which I suspect similar ones have also been sent to you.

I have seen those destined for Bern and Basel; however, since I have not seen yours, so that you are not unaware, I have sent ours and beg you, as much as I can, not to return them without your judgment.

For a long time, there has been a rumor among us that there was a battle at Paris and that our side was victorious; however, since nothing certain is written to confirm that rumor, we begin to doubt with sorrow.

I beg you, my lord and brother, to inform us through our Jonvill about the certain affairs of France; I know he is overwhelmed with other matters, but Jonvill will serve us in this matter, both for you and for us, whom you will greet in our name.
Our Immontani and Palestini are now plotting something new against the Claronenses; for the wicked have no peace.
Educate the third Pole, a man of integrity, well; this man can be of great benefit to the churches of Poland.
To the most illustrious man, Mr. Johannes Calvin, faithful pastor of the church of Geneva, my venerable lord and dearest brother.
